column5: Saw the first ice hut out there yesterday. Still, best to be safe!

With the weather the last few weeks it is quite likely that the ice is starting off very nice (always check for yourself) and relatively safe for foot travel and a permeant hut on the smaller lakes. However, given the type of weather we've had in the last 20 years (huge temp swings and green Christmases) in central Ontario I would be hesitant to put out and a permanent hut at this point.
They've been out there for over 2 weeks already.
I myself find no fun having to watch where I step because the ice may be safe,That lake freezes early,be carefull everyone,I can wait a bit.
Dave,were looking for a heavier guy then me to join our group. I want a break from being the leader. LOL

Dave,were looking for a heavier guy then me to join our group. I want a break from being the leader. LOL Not me Brian,sorry lol.give me a shout when I don't have to worry to much about that.Always had a fright in me about ice,even growing up on Bluewater beach,lake front for my first 21 years.Had to help many people during that time,doing stupid things,and it put a fright into me.You seem to know what your doing and that's great.Would love to join you guys anytime!
Call Lawrence Park for ice updates. They should know the conditions.
Misfish made me a spud a few years back. I walk with that, and keep my significantly larger brother a loooooong way away from me.
Call Lawrence Park for ice updates. They should know the conditions.  Closed for the season. Dont waste yer 50 cents.LOL Too bad. Would be nice to have a coffee and breakie,before heading out.
Misfish made me a spud a few years back. I walk with that, and keep my significantly larger brother a loooooong way away from me.  Im sure,that you being the loving brother,you are,your the leader .
Dave,were looking for a heavier guy then me to join our group. I want a break from being the leader. LOL Just make the case that the lightest one should lead the way, spud in hand
no  the heaviest person should lead, if the lightest person  walks out  all everyone knows is the ice is safe for him if the heaviest person tests the ice we know it's safe for all in the group
Forget little lake....here is the view from orillia looking south.....ice as far as the eye can see.   Although only 1/4 inch thick.  But it's a start
Theres no fish in that spot. Need a bass boat to fish there.LOL
